content: For the fourth quarter of 2022, Ambac reported net income of $175 million or $3.86 per diluted share compared to a net loss of $22 million or $0.42 per diluted share in the fourth quarter of 2021. More specifically, the decrease in investment income during the fourth quarter of 2022 related to a net gain on fund investments of about $2 million compared to a $13 million gain in the fourth quarter of 2021. Net gains on derivative contracts, which remain positioned as a partial economic hedge against interest rate exposure in the financial guarantee and investment portfolios were $5 million for the fourth quarter compared to $3 million for the fourth quarter of 2021.
